original: Key, Kerstin Elisabeth Maria, konsthantverkare, skriftställarinna, Stjärnorp o. Sthlm, f. 3/4/71 i Österkorsberga, Jöiiköp. 1., av öv.-löjtn. Carl K. o. Hedvig Rääf i Småland. — Graffmanska sk. i Växjö, konstfaoksk. (£d. teikn. sk.) i Sthlm 88-91, Nääs slöjdlär :sem. 94-95, The Northhampton Inst. i London 07-08, stud. social verksamh. o. settle-ment movement i Londons East End samt arb. i polisfören. On and off duty i London 91-92. Stud :res. i Engl., Frankr., TyskL, Österr., Ital., Grekl., Palestina o. Egypt., komm:koll. rese-stip. 02. Start. o. förestod egen arb:-stuga f. ett 100-tal fattiga barn i Nybergsgränd o. Sthlms arb :hem 89-99, start. Sv:es första kindergarten 92, söndagssk :verksamh. 89-04, Södra KFUK 90-94, egen skola f. slöjd o. konstslöjd i Sthlm 92-08, eget kostn:-fritt vilohem f. självförsörj. kvinnor v. Ekeliden i Stjärnorpis s :n, östergötl. 1., 09-25, undervisat i bokbinderi i Soifi Almquists samsk. 28-36, dito i Kungsholmens komm. flicksk. 40-43. Utf. beställn. bl. a. t. flera av kungahusets medlemmar. Sv. slöjdfören., NK, Sv. hemslöjd, kyrkor o. priv:-personer i drivning, ciselering, gyllenläder m. m. Erhåli. patent på sop-skyffel m. lånigt skaft 22, bokbin-deripreSiS 24. Ordf. i Östergötlands 1. hemslöjdsfören. förvaltn :utsk. 10-15, led. av komm. f. standardisering av byggn :material 19-36, anordn. i samb. härmed utställn. av komm. modellkök i Gbg, Lidingö samt Bygge o. Bo i Sthlm 19, 22, 23, 24, 25 o. 30 samt i Helsingfors 24, led. av östergötl. 1. hush :sällsk., hed:led. i Kvinnl. kont :-fören. Medl. av Nya Idun o. Zonta International. Skr.: Amatörbokbin-deri (16), Fljälp dig själv (17), Hemvård (39), Hantverk i hemmet (40), Korta råd f. hemmets vård (44), Prakt, fritidsnöjen o. hobbies (44), medarb. i Köket o. ekonomiavd. i Bostaden 34 samt i Hemkunskap 42, medarb. i ett flert. tidskr., föredr :håll. i Sv:es hus-miodersföreningar 15-40. Hobby: konsthantverk. FinlVRO, Finl. Marthafö-ren. guldm., flera pris o. diplom.
translated: Key, Kerstin Elisabeth Maria, artisan, writer, Stjärnorp and Stockholm, b. April 3, 1971 in Österkorsberga, Jöiiköp. 1., daughter of Lieutenant Colonel Carl K. and Hedvig Rääf in Småland. — Graffmanska school in Växjö, art vocational school (£drawing school) in Stockholm 88-91, Nääs handicraft teacher seminar 94-95, The Northhampton Institute in London 07-08, studied social work and settlement movement in London's East End, and worked in the police association on and off duty in London 91-92. Studied abroad in England, France, Germany, Austria, Italy, Greece, Palestine, and Egypt, with a travel grant from the Swedish Committee for Combating Prostitution 02. Started and managed her own workshop for about 100 underprivileged children in Nybergsgränd, and Stockholm's work home 89-99, started Sweden's first kindergarten 92, Sunday school activities 89-04, Southern YWCA 90-94, own school for crafts and decorative arts in Stockholm 92-08, own cost-free rest home for self-supporting women in Ekeliden, Stjärnorpis s :n, Östergotland, 09-25, taught bookbinding at Soifi Almquist's coeducational school 28-36, and at Kungsholmen's municipal girls' school 40-43. Carried out commissions for several members of the royal family. Swedish Handicrafts Association, NK, Swedish Handicrafts, churches, and private individuals in chasing, gilding leather, etc. Received a patent for a broom with a long handle 22, bookbinding prize 24. Chairman of the Östergotland County Handicrafts Association's management committee 10-15; member of the committee for standardization of building materials 19-36; organized exhibitions of model kitchens in Gothenburg, Lidingö, and Construction and Housing in Stockholm in connection with this 19, 22, 23, 24, 25, and 30, and in Helsinki 24; member of the Östergotland County Home Economics Society; honorary member of the Women's Accounting Association; member of Nya Idun and Zonta International. Writings: Amateur Bookbinding (16), Help Yourself (17), Home Care (39), Crafts at Home (40), Short Advice for Household Care (44), Practical Hobbies and Pastimes (44), contributed to Köket and the Economics Department in Bostaden 34, and to Home Economics 42; collaborated in several magazines; delivered lectures for Sweden's housewives' associations 15-40. Hobby: artisan crafts. Recipient of the Order of the Lion of Finland, the Martha Association's gold medal, and several prizes and diplomas.
